title: Smarter auto-passing with bluff support
description:
pass_priority currently auto-passes whenever there are no playable cards. This is efficient but prevents bluffing (holding priority to represent a trick). We deleted auto_pass_until_event, wait_for_action, and is_action_on_me as redundant/dangerous tools, but the underlying need remains: smarter priority management.

Proposed direction:
- Add a bluff mode to pass_priority where the LLM can opt to hold priority for a configurable duration even when there's nothing to play, to represent interaction.
- Consider stop conditions: stop_on_combat, stop_on_stack_nonempty, stop_on_life_change, etc. so the LLM can be more selective about when it wants control back.
- Return which stop condition fired (stop_reason) for deterministic client handling.

Design questions:
1. Which stop conditions are reliably detectable from existing callback/game state surfaces?
2. How should bluff timing work â€” fixed delay, or until opponent acts?
3. How should this interact with timeout semantics?

Suggested source area: Mage.Client.Headless/src/main/java/mage/client/headless/BridgeCallbackHandler.java:passPriority and McpServer tool schema.
